---
title: "Manage groups"
---

Invite new users and assign users to specific groups to maintain access control and efficient user management within your organization via the {{< var validmind.platform >}}. 

## Prerequisites

- {{< var link.login >}}

- You are a `Customer Admin`, or assigned another role with sufficient permissions to perform the tasks in this guide.[^1] 

::: {.callout-important}
Ensure that the group details align with your requirements for access control and group management.
:::
## See group details

1. Click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**. 

2. Under **User Permissions** in the sidebar, select **Groups**. 

3. Expand **See Details** to:
   - View the group's name and description.
   - View the complete list of members in any group.
   - View models visible to the group.

## Add new groups

1. Click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**.

{{< include _manage-groups-add.qmd >}}

## Remove groups
:::{.callout}
You can only remove non-default groups.
:::

1. Click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**. 

2. Under **User Permissions** in the sidebar, select **Groups**.

3. Expand **See Details >** for the group you want to remove.

4. Click **Delete Group** to remove it.

## Add or remove group members

1. Click **{{< fa gear >}} Settings**. 

2. Under **User Permissions** in the sidebar, select **Groups**. 

#### To add a member to a group:

1. Click **See Details**.

1. Click {{< fa circle-plus >}} **Add New Member**.

1. Select members by checking the boxes next to their names in the pop-up.

1. Click {{< fa circle-plus >}} **Add to Group**.

#### To remove a member from a group:

1. Click **See Details**.

1. Select members by checking the boxes next to their names.

1. Click **Remove Member**.


<!-- FOOTNOTES -->

[^1]: [Manage permissions](/guide/configuration/manage-permissions.qmd)
